trans-unit.source: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authentication users for single sign-on with ADAL in your Windows Store application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authentication users for single sign-on with ADAL in your Windows Store application.

trans-unit.source: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using the Active Directory Authentication Library to support [client-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj710106.aspx) with Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using the Active Directory Authentication Library to support [client-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj710106.aspx) with Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: To support [service-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn283952.aspx) with Azure Active Directory, start with the [Add authentication to your Mobile Services app](../mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-users.md) tutorial.
trans-unit.target: To support [service-directed login operations](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn283952.aspx) with Azure Active Directory, start with the [Add authentication to your Mobile Services app](../mobile-services-dotnet-backend-windows-store-dotnet-get-started-users.md) tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To be able to authenticate users, you must register your application with the Azure Active Directory (AAD).
trans-unit.target: To be able to authenticate users, you must register your application with the Azure Active Directory (AAD).

trans-unit.source: This is done in two steps.
trans-unit.target: This is done in two steps.

trans-unit.source: First, you must register your mobile service and expose permissions on it.
trans-unit.target: First, you must register your mobile service and expose permissions on it.

trans-unit.source: Second, you must register your Windows Store app and grant it access to those permissions
trans-unit.target: Second, you must register your Windows Store app and grant it access to those permissions

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to do single sign-on Azure Active Directory authentication for Windows Store apps using a [client-directed login operation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj710106.aspx).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to do single sign-on Azure Active Directory authentication for Windows Store apps using a [client-directed login operation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj710106.aspx).

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013 running on Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013 running on Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Services] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services SDK NuGet package
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services SDK NuGet package

trans-unit.source: Active Directory Authentication Library NuGet package
trans-unit.target: Active Directory Authentication Library NuGet package

trans-unit.source: Register your app with the Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Register your app with the Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: To register the app with Azure Active Directory, you must associate it to the Windows Store and have a package security identifier (SID) for the app.
trans-unit.target: To register the app with Azure Active Directory, you must associate it to the Windows Store and have a package security identifier (SID) for the app.

trans-unit.source: The package SID gets registered with the native application settings in the Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The package SID gets registered with the native application settings in the Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Associate the app with a new store app name
trans-unit.target: Associate the app with a new store app name

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right click the client app project and click **Store** and **Associate App with the Store**
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right click the client app project and click **Store** and **Associate App with the Store**

trans-unit.source: Sign into your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Sign into your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Enter the app name you want to reserve for the app and click **Reserve**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the app name you want to reserve for the app and click **Reserve**.

trans-unit.source: Select the new app name and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the new app name and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Associate** to associate the app with the store name.
trans-unit.target: Click **Associate** to associate the app with the store name.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the package SID for your app.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the package SID for your app.

trans-unit.source: Now you need to retrieve your package SID which will be configured with the native app settings.
trans-unit.target: Now you need to retrieve your package SID which will be configured with the native app settings.

trans-unit.source: Log into your [Windows Dev Center Dashboard] and click **Edit** on the app.
trans-unit.target: Log into your [Windows Dev Center Dashboard] and click **Edit** on the app.

trans-unit.source: Then click **App management** > **App identity** and Copy your package SID from the page.
trans-unit.target: Then click **App management** > **App identity** and Copy your package SID from the page.

trans-unit.source: Create the native app registration
trans-unit.target: Create the native app registration

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Active Directory** in the [classic portal], then click your directory.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Active Directory** in the [classic portal], then click your directory.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Applications** tab at the top, then click to **ADD** an app.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Applications** tab at the top, then click to **ADD** an app.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add an application my organization is developing**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add an application my organization is developing**.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Native Client Application** type.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Native Client Application** type.

trans-unit.source: Then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: In the **Redirect URI** box, paste the App package SID you copied earlier then click to complete the native app registration.
trans-unit.target: In the **Redirect URI** box, paste the App package SID you copied earlier then click to complete the native app registration.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Configure** tab for the native application and copy the **Client ID**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Configure** tab for the native application and copy the **Client ID**.

trans-unit.source: You will need this later.
trans-unit.target: You will need this later.

trans-unit.source: Scroll the page down to the **permissions to other applications** section and grant full access to the mobile service application that you registered earlier.
trans-unit.target: Scroll the page down to the **permissions to other applications** section and grant full access to the mobile service application that you registered earlier.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**

trans-unit.source: Your mobile service is now configured in AAD to receive single sign-on logins from your app.
trans-unit.target: Your mobile service is now configured in AAD to receive single sign-on logins from your app.

trans-unit.source: Configure the mobile service to require authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure the mobile service to require authentication

trans-unit.source: Add authentication code to the client app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication code to the client app

trans-unit.source: Open your Windows store client app project in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open your Windows store client app project in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer window of Visual Studio, open the MainPage.cs file and add the following using statements.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer window of Visual Studio, open the MainPage.cs file and add the following using statements.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the MainPage class which declares the `AuthenticateAsync` method.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the MainPage class which declares the `AuthenticateAsync` method.

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `AuthenticateAsync` method above, replace **INSERT-AUTHORITY-HERE** with the name of the tenant in which you provisioned your application, the format should be https://login.windows.net/tenant-name.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `AuthenticateAsync` method above, replace **INSERT-AUTHORITY-HERE** with the name of the tenant in which you provisioned your application, the format should be https://login.windows.net/tenant-name.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: This value can be copied out of the Domain tab in your Azure Active Directory in the [Azure classic portal].
trans-unit.target: This value can be copied out of the Domain tab in your Azure Active Directory in the [Azure classic portal].

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `AuthenticateAsync` method above, replace **INSERT-RESOURCE-URI-HERE** with the **App ID URI** for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `AuthenticateAsync` method above, replace **INSERT-RESOURCE-URI-HERE** with the **App ID URI** for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you followed the [How to Register with the Azure Active Directory] topic your App ID URI should be similar to https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/login/aad.
trans-unit.target: If you followed the [How to Register with the Azure Active Directory] topic your App ID URI should be similar to https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/login/aad.

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `AuthenticateAsync` method above, replace **INSERT-CLIENT-ID-HERE** with the client ID you copied from the native client application.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `AuthenticateAsync` method above, replace **INSERT-CLIENT-ID-HERE** with the client ID you copied from the native client application.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution Explorer window for Visual Studio, open the Package.appxmanifest file in the client project.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution Explorer window for Visual Studio, open the Package.appxmanifest file in the client project.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Capabilities** tab and enable **Enterprise Application** and **Private Networks (Client & Server)**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Capabilities** tab and enable **Enterprise Application** and **Private Networks (Client & Server)**.

trans-unit.source: Save the file.
trans-unit.target: Save the file.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.cs file, update the `OnNavigatedTo` event handler to call the `AuthenticateAsync` method as follows.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.cs file, update the `OnNavigatedTo` event handler to call the `AuthenticateAsync` method as follows.

trans-unit.source: Test the client using authentication
trans-unit.target: Test the client using authentication

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio,run the client app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio,run the client app.

trans-unit.source: You will receive a prompt to login against your Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a prompt to login against your Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The app authenticates and returns the todo items.
trans-unit.target: The app authenticates and returns the todo items.
